docs.title: Automating Blog Deployment with GitHub Actions
docs.text: In this post, I'll show you how I automated the deployment of this blog using GitHub Actions. We'll cover setting up continuous integration to check markdown files and automatically deploy to GitHub Pages.

docs.title: Why Automation?
docs.text:
Automation helps ensure:

  1. Consistent quality through linting
  2. Automatic deployment on merges
  3. No manual deployment steps
  4. Version control and review process

docs.title: Setting Up GitHub Actions
docs.text:
Here's how we set up our GitHub Actions workflow:

name: CI
on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Lint Markdown files
        uses: DavidAnson/markdownlint-cli2-action@v15

  deploy:
    needs: lint
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
      - run: pip install mkdocs-material
      - run: mkdocs gh-deploy --force

docs.title: Results
docs.text:
Now, every time we push to main:

  1. Markdown files are checked for consistency
  2. The site is automatically built and deployed
  3. Changes are live within minutes

This automation has made maintaining the blog much easier!

docs.title: Essential Digital Security Practices for 2025
docs.text: As our lives become increasingly digital, protecting our online presence has never been more crucial. Here's what you need to know about digital security in 2025.

docs.title: The Current Threat Landscape
docs.text:
Digital threats have evolved significantly:

  • Advanced phishing attempts
  • AI-powered attacks
  • Quantum computing threats
  • Social engineering tactics

docs.title: 1. Password Management
docs.text:
Modern password best practices:

  • Use a password manager
  • Enable two-factor authentication
  • Implement biometric security
  • Regular password rotation

docs.title: 2. Data Encryption
docs.text:
Protect your sensitive information:

  • End-to-end encryption for communications
  • Full disk encryption for devices
  • Encrypted backups
  • Secure file sharing

docs.title: 3. Network Security
docs.text:
Secure your connections:

  • Use a reputable VPN
  • Enable firewall protection
  • Regular network monitoring
  • Secure home Wi-Fi setup

docs.title: Privacy Considerations
docs.text:
Protect your personal information:

  1. Regular privacy audits
  2. Social media privacy settings
  3. Data access controls
  4. Digital footprint management

docs.title: Emerging Technologies
docs.text:
Stay aware of new security tools:

  • Quantum encryption
  • AI-powered security systems
  • Blockchain authentication
  • Zero-trust architectures

docs.title: Action Steps
docs.text:
1. Conduct a security audit
  2. Update all passwords
  3. Enable available security features
  4. Regular backup schedule

Remember: Security is not a one-time setup but an ongoing process that requires regular attention and updates.

docs.title: Getting Started with MkDocs
docs.text: MkDocs is a fantastic static site generator that's perfect for creating documentation sites and blogs. In this post, I'll share my experience setting up this blog using MkDocs and the Material theme.

docs.title: Why MkDocs?
docs.text:
There are several reasons why I chose MkDocs for my blog:

  1. Markdown-based: Writing in Markdown is simple and efficient
  2. Python-powered: Easy to extend and customize
  3. Material Design: Beautiful out-of-the-box with the Material theme
  4. Fast: Static site generation means excellent performance

docs.title: Setting Up
docs.text:
The setup process was straightforward. Here's what I did:

pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material
mkdocs new .

docs.title: Customization
docs.text:
The Material theme offers extensive customization options. Here's my configuration:

theme:
  name: material
  features:
    - navigation.instant
    - navigation.tracking

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text: MkDocs has proven to be an excellent choice for my blogging needs. The combination of Markdown support, Python extensibility, and the Material theme's features makes it a powerful platform for technical writing.

docs.title: Mathematics in Markdown
docs.text: This post demonstrates how to use mathematical formulas in our blog posts using MathJax.

docs.title: Inline Formulas
docs.text:
You can write inline formulas using \( and \). For example, here's Einstein's famous equation: \(E = mc^2\).

Here's another example of the quadratic formula: \(x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}\)

docs.title: Display Formulas
docs.text:
For larger formulas, you can use \[ and \] to create display-style mathematics. Here's a beautiful integral:

\[ \int_0^\infty e^{-x^2} dx = \frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2} \]

Here's another example showing the definition of the derivative:

\[ f'(x) = \lim_{h \to 0} \frac{f(x + h) - f(x)}{h} \]

docs.title: Complex Examples
docs.text: You can also write more complex mathematical expressions:

docs.title: Matrix
docs.text: \[ \begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} ax + by \\ cx + dy \end{pmatrix} \]

docs.title: Greek Letters and Special Symbols
docs.text:
• Alpha: \(\alpha\)
  • Beta: \(\beta\)
  • Gamma: \(\gamma\)
  • Pi: \(\pi\)
  • Infinity: \(\infty\)
  • Partial derivative: \(\partial\)

docs.title: Equations with Numbers
docs.text:
You can also write equations with numbers:

\[ \begin{equation} E = mc^2 \tag{1} \end{equation} \] \[ \begin{equation} F = ma \tag{2} \end{equation} \]

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text: As you can see, we can write any kind of mathematical formula, from simple inline equations to complex mathematical expressions with matrices, integrals, and more!

docs.title: The Power of Deep Work in a Distracted World
docs.text: In today's constantly connected world, the ability to perform deep work has become increasingly valuable. Let's explore how to cultivate this crucial skill.

docs.title: What is Deep Work???
docs.text: Deep work refers to the ability to focus without distraction on a cognitively demanding task. It's a skill that allows you to quickly master complicated information and produce better results in less time.

docs.title: The Cost of Distraction
docs.text:
Modern workplace challenges include:

  • Constant email notifications
  • Endless chat messages
  • Social media temptations
  • Meeting overload

docs.title: 1. Schedule Deep Work Blocks
docs.text:
Create dedicated time blocks for focused work:

  • Morning hours (2-4 hours)
  • Afternoon sessions
  • Evening reflection time

docs.title: 2. Create a Ritual
docs.text:
Develop a consistent routine:

  1. Choose your location
  2. Set specific duration
  3. Define rules (no phones, etc.)
  4. Ensure you have support (snacks, drinks)

docs.title: 3. Measure Your Progress
docs.text:
Track your deep work hours and achievements:

  • Hours of focused work
  • Tasks completed
  • Quality of output

docs.title: Benefits of Deep Work
docs.text:
• Increased productivity
  • Better quality output
  • Improved job satisfaction
  • Enhanced learning ability
  • Reduced stress

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Begin with small steps: 1. Start with 30-minute blocks 2. Gradually increase duration 3. Build consistent habits 4. Celebrate progress

Remember, deep work is a skill that can be developed with practice and dedication.

Commands:
